entities.name: Indication
entities.description: Indication (aka. Disease) based on chembl

entities.name: Disease Terms
entities.description: This dataset is a comprehensive glossary of Disease Terms, primarily sourced from MeSH. It details specific diseases, injuries, or conditions, offering various ways to identify and understand them. This resource is crucial for standardizing disease terminology and exploring medical conditions.

entities.name: Disease
entities.description: This dataset, primarily derived from MONDO, provides a structured collection of human diseases. It focuses on offering key identifiers and links to genetic information for each disease, proving valuable for researchers connecting diseases with their genetic roots and understanding core definitions.

entities.name: Activity
entities.description: Activity captures experimental measurements of compound-target interactions, including assay results, binding data, and functional responses. It serves as a linking table between compounds, biological targets, cell lines, and tissues, storing both quantitative measurements and experimental context.

entities.name: Drug
entities.description: Therapeutic agents with standardized SMILES notation, chemical properties, and pharmacological annotations from ChEMBL and DrugCentral. Features include mechanism of action, target interactions, clinical indications, development phase, and therapeutic classifications. Cross-referenced with compound structures and bioactivity data.

entities.name: Transcript
entities.description: The Transcript entity represents individual RNA transcripts associated with genes, capturing their expression levels (TPM) across GTEx samples. It links to the Genes entity and provides detailed transcript-level data and sample-specific expression. This entity enables analysis of transcript diversity and tissue-specific expression patterns.

entities.name: ClinVar Variants
entities.description: Variants represent genomic alterations characterized in ClinVar, including single nucleotide changes, insertions, deletions, and structural variations. This entity captures clinical significance, phenotypic associations, and functional impacts of genetic variants, providing crucial connections between genes and their disease-associated mutations.

entities.name: Compound
entities.description: Chemical entities from ChEMBL, DrugCentral, and DrugBank, encompassing structure, properties, mechanisms of action, and clinical applications. Includes both approved drugs and experimental compounds.

entities.name: Gene
entities.description: Core genetic elements with canonical information from Ensembl and HGNC, including gene symbols, descriptions, genomic coordinates, and biotype classifications.

entities.name: Protein
entities.description: Protein products with structural and functional annotations, including domains, modifications, and interactions. Incorporates UniProt features and cross-references to protein families.

entities.name: Pathway
entities.description: Biological pathways showing molecular interactions and regulatory networks. Integrates data from major pathway databases to provide functional context for genes and proteins (e.g. Reactome and MSigDB; curated set of BIOCARTA, CGP, CP, KEGG_LEGACY, KEGG_MEDICUS, PID, REACTOME, WIKIPATHWAYS).

entities.name: Pathway
entities.description: Mapping between genes and pathways based on Reactome and MSigDB (curated set of BIOCARTA, CGP, CP, KEGG_LEGACY, KEGG_MEDICUS, PID, REACTOME, WIKIPATHWAYS).

entities.name: Cell Line
entities.description: DepMap-cataloged cell lines with extensive characterization data, including genetic dependencies, drug responses, and molecular profiles.

entities.name: Depmap Cell Line Expression
entities.description: Cell line expression from DepMap

entities.name: TCGA Tissue
entities.description: The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA), a landmark cancer genomics program, molecularly characterized over 20,000 primary cancer and matched normal samples spanning 33 cancer types.

entities.name: TCGA Mutation
entities.description: The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA), a landmark cancer genomics program, molecularly characterized over 20,000 primary cancer and matched normal samples spanning 33 cancer types.

entities.name: TCGA Copy Number
entities.description: TCGA copy number

entities.name: Gene Fusion
entities.description: TCGA Fusions catalogues 20731 gene fusions detected in 9966 well characterized cancer samples and 648 normal specimens from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA), spanning 33 cancer types. Fusion transcripts were identified via a uniform pipeline, including filtering against a list of 3838 transcript fusions detected in a panel of 648 non-neoplastic samples.

entities.name: TCGA Expression
entities.description: TCGA Expression

entities.name: GTEx Tissue
entities.description: The Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project is an ongoing effort to build a comprehensive public resource to study tissue-specific gene expression and regulation.

entities.name: GTEx Expression
entities.description: GTEx Expression

campaignType.name: Gene
campaignType.description: Target campaigns are used to prioritize and answer questions of targets

predefinedQuestions.text: Is there literature supporting the rationale of gene-disease association?
What is the druggability of the target?
What is the competition status of the target? Are there advanced clinical programs?
For the target, what is the gene/protein expression level in the relevant tissue?
